revisions.description: Add adapt level table , commit and reset command
Add quick access to channel modulation and pilots

ModulationValue.name: ModulationValue
ModulationValue.description: Modulation amplitude used by a group of carriers.

CarrierValue.name: CarrierValue
CarrierValue.description: A group is composed of 8 carriers.

PilotValue.name: PilotValue
PilotValue.description: The pilot carrier wave can be chosen between the carrier 1 up to carrier 128 inside a band carrier range.

BandValue.name: BandValue
BandValue.description: A channel is composed of 7 bands.

PlcChannelType.name: PlcChannelType
PlcChannelType.description: The different type of plc channels: rx for the current reception channel, rx last for the last reception channel, tx for the current transmission channel.

EstimationMode.name: EstimationMode
EstimationMode.description: The type of Channel estimation process. Two are available: - automatic, the equipment negociates the best configuration with the remote equipment, - manual, the operator defines the configuration.

GroupValue.name: GroupValue
GroupValue.description: A band is composed of 16 groups.

SoftwareActionResultValue.name: SoftwareActionResultValue
SoftwareActionResultValue.description: Result value of software action process.

portStatsTable.name: portStatsTable
portStatsTable.description: This table gathers all statistic data specific to SPC200 chip relative to plc connection.

portStatsEntry.name: portStatsEntry
portStatsEntry.description: This row contains statistic data specific to SPC200 chip relative to a connection.

portStatsBandIndex.name: portStatsBandIndex
portStatsBandIndex.description: The band number on which the signal, noise, ber data are collected.

portStatsGroupIndex.name: portStatsGroupIndex
portStatsGroupIndex.description: The group number on which the signal, noise, ber data are collected

portStatsCarrierIndex.name: portStatsCarrierIndex
portStatsCarrierIndex.description: The group number on which the signal, noise, ber data are collected

portStatsSignal.name: portStatsSignal
portStatsSignal.description: The DB value of the signal associated with the carrier wave entry.

portStatsNoise.name: portStatsNoise
portStatsNoise.description: The DB value of the noise associated with the carrier wave entry.

portStats2Table.name: portStats2Table
portStats2Table.description: This table gathers all statistic data specific to SPC200 chip relative to plc channels. This table has the same information as the portChannelStatsTable but in a more compact way. This table has been added to deal with possible slow performances.

portStats2Entry.name: portStats2Entry
portStats2Entry.description: This row contains statistic data specific to SPC200 chip relative to a connection.

portStats2Signal.name: portStats2Signal
portStats2Signal.description: The values of the signal for all the carrier waves. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is coded on two bytes. There is one value for each 128 carriers of the considered band.

portStats2Noise.name: portStats2Noise
portStats2Noise.description: The values of the noise for all the carrier waves. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is coded on two bytes. There is one value for each 128 carriers of the considered band.

portStats3Table.name: portStats3Table
portStats3Table.description: This table gathers all statistic data specific to SPC200 chip relative to plc channels. This table has the same information as the portChannelStatsTable but in a more compact way. This table has been added to deal with possible slow performances.

portStats3Entry.name: portStats3Entry
portStats3Entry.description: This row contains statistic data specific to SPC200 chip relative to a connection.

plcSNAnalyserEnable.name: plcSNAnalyserEnable
plcSNAnalyserEnable.description: true if the modem should turn to spectrum analyser mode. In this mode the modem enters a receive only mode, and captures periodic samples of the signal on the powerline. The spectrum analyser mode shall be disabled for normal powerline modem operation.

plcSNAnalyserTable.name: plcSNAnalyserTable
plcSNAnalyserTable.description: This table gathers all statistic data specific to SPC200 chip relative to plc analyser.

plcSNAnalyserEntry.name: plcSNAnalyserEntry
plcSNAnalyserEntry.description: This row contains statistic data specific to SPC200 chip relative to a band.

plcSNAnalyserMinSignal.name: plcSNAnalyserMinSignal
plcSNAnalyserMinSignal.description: Minimum signal measured over several samples for the associated carrier wave entry. The value is expressed in Glomer which can be converted in dBm/Hz using the following formula: dBm/Hz = 19*log10(Glomer) - 113

plcSNAnalyserMaxSignal.name: plcSNAnalyserMaxSignal
plcSNAnalyserMaxSignal.description: Maximum signal measured on several samples for the associated carrier wave entry. The value is expressed in Glomer which can be converted in dBm/Hz using the following formula: dBm/Hz = 19*log10(Glomer) - 113

plcSNAnalyserAvgSignal.name: plcSNAnalyserAvgSignal
plcSNAnalyserAvgSignal.description: Average signal measured on several samples for the associated carrier wave entry. The value is expressed in Glomer which can be converted in dBm/Hz using the following formula: dBm/Hz = 19*log10(Glomer) - 113

plcSNAnalyserLastSignal.name: plcSNAnalyserLastSignal
plcSNAnalyserLastSignal.description: Signal measured for last sample on the associated carrier wave entry. The value is expressed in Glomer which can be converted in dBm/Hz using the following formula: dBm/Hz = 19*log10(Glomer) - 113

plcSNAnalyserFFTDiv.name: plcSNAnalyserFFTDiv
plcSNAnalyserFFTDiv.description: FFT division factor on the associated band.

plcSNAnalyserAGC.name: plcSNAnalyserAGC
plcSNAnalyserAGC.description: Gain factor in dB, as used by the Automatic Gain Control last sample

plcTopoChanges.name: plcTopoChanges
plcTopoChanges.description: The total number of topology changes detected by this plc bridge since the management entity was last reset or initialized. Such changes concerns only - the plcBasePortTable rows - the plcBasePortTable columns except for plcBasePortChannelEstimation

plcBasePortTable.name: plcBasePortTable
plcBasePortTable.description: This table contains the list of plc remote connection

plcBasePortEntry.name: plcBasePortEntry
plcBasePortEntry.description: This row contains plc remote connection information

plcBasePortIndex.name: plcBasePortIndex
plcBasePortIndex.description: The MAC address of the MAC layer above the plc interface of the remote PLC equipment.

plcBasePortAddress.name: plcBasePortAddress
plcBasePortAddress.description: The MAC address of the MAC layer above the plc interface of the remote PLC equipment.

plcBasePortChannelEstimation.name: plcBasePortChannelEstimation
plcBasePortChannelEstimation.description: Enable or disable the automatic channel estimation processus.

plcChannelModulationStringTable.name: plcChannelModulationStringTable
plcChannelModulationStringTable.description: This table contains string values for a quick access to the modulation amplitude configurations of all active channels.

plcChannelModulationStringEntry.name: plcChannelModulationStringEntry
plcChannelModulationStringEntry.description: This row contains string values for a quick access to the modulation amplitude configuration of each active channel of the remote connection referenced by plcBasePortIndex.

plcRxChannelModulation.name: plcRxChannelModulation
plcRxChannelModulation.description: The modulation amplitude values for the Rx channel of a given remote connection entry. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is an octet representing two modulation values. Each modulation is coded on 4 bits. There are ( 16 groups * 7 bands ) / 2 = 66 values.

plcRxLastChannelModulation.name: plcRxLastChannelModulation
plcRxLastChannelModulation.description: The modulation amplitude values for the Rx Last channel of a given remote connection entry. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is an octet representing two modulation values. Each modulation is coded on 4 bits representing ModulationValue - 1. There are ( 16 groups * 7 bands ) / 2 = 66 values.

plcTxChannelModulation.name: plcTxChannelModulation
plcTxChannelModulation.description: The modulation amplitude values for the Tx channel of a given remote connection entry. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is an octet representing two modulation values. Each modulation is coded on 4 bits. There are ( 16 groups * 7 bands ) / 2 = 66 values.

plcChannelModulationTable.name: plcChannelModulationTable
plcChannelModulationTable.description: This table contains the modulation amplitude configuration of all active channels.

plcChannelModulationEntry.name: plcChannelModulationEntry
plcChannelModulationEntry.description: This row contains modulation amplitude configuration of the channel, referenced by the plcPortChannelIndex, of the remote connection referenced by plcBasePortIndex.

plcModBandIndex.name: plcModBandIndex
plcModBandIndex.description: The band number of which the modulations are defined

plcModGroup1.name: plcModGroup1
plcModGroup1.description: The modulation amplitude of the first group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup2.name: plcModGroup2
plcModGroup2.description: The modulation amplitude of the second group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup3.name: plcModGroup3
plcModGroup3.description: The modulation amplitude of the third group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup4.name: plcModGroup4
plcModGroup4.description: The modulation amplitude of the fourth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup5.name: plcModGroup5
plcModGroup5.description: The modulation amplitude of the fifth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup6.name: plcModGroup6
plcModGroup6.description: The modulation amplitude of the sixth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup7.name: plcModGroup7
plcModGroup7.description: The modulation amplitude of the seventh group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup8.name: plcModGroup8
plcModGroup8.description: The modulation amplitude of the eighth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup9.name: plcModGroup9
plcModGroup9.description: The modulation amplitude of the nineth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup10.name: plcModGroup10
plcModGroup10.description: The modulation amplitude of the tenth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup11.name: plcModGroup11
plcModGroup11.description: The modulation amplitude of the eleventh group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup12.name: plcModGroup12
plcModGroup12.description: The modulation amplitude of the twelveth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup13.name: plcModGroup13
plcModGroup13.description: The modulation amplitude of the thirteenth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup14.name: plcModGroup14
plcModGroup14.description: The modulation amplitude of the fourteenth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup15.name: plcModGroup15
plcModGroup15.description: The modulation amplitude of the fifteenth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModGroup16.name: plcModGroup16
plcModGroup16.description: The modulation amplitude of the sixteenth group of the band entry of the channel entry for a given remote connection entry.

plcModulationInputAddr.name: plcModulationInputAddr
plcModulationInputAddr.description: The MAC address of the MAC layer above the plc interface of the remote PLC equipment for which the modulation value changes are requested.

plcModulationInputChannel.name: plcModulationInputChannel
plcModulationInputChannel.description: The channel type of the remote PLC equipment for which the modulation value changes are requested.

plcModulationInputBand.name: plcModulationInputBand
plcModulationInputBand.description: The band number of which the modulation value changes are requested.

plcInputModulationGroup1.name: plcInputModulationGroup1
plcInputModulationGroup1.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the first group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup2.name: plcInputModulationGroup2
plcInputModulationGroup2.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the second group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup3.name: plcInputModulationGroup3
plcInputModulationGroup3.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the third group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup4.name: plcInputModulationGroup4
plcInputModulationGroup4.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the fourth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup5.name: plcInputModulationGroup5
plcInputModulationGroup5.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the fifth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup6.name: plcInputModulationGroup6
plcInputModulationGroup6.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the sixth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup7.name: plcInputModulationGroup7
plcInputModulationGroup7.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the seventh group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup8.name: plcInputModulationGroup8
plcInputModulationGroup8.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the eighth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup9.name: plcInputModulationGroup9
plcInputModulationGroup9.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the nineth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup10.name: plcInputModulationGroup10
plcInputModulationGroup10.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the tenth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup11.name: plcInputModulationGroup11
plcInputModulationGroup11.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the eleventh group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup12.name: plcInputModulationGroup12
plcInputModulationGroup12.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the twelveth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup13.name: plcInputModulationGroup13
plcInputModulationGroup13.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the thirteenth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup14.name: plcInputModulationGroup14
plcInputModulationGroup14.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the fourteenth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup15.name: plcInputModulationGroup15
plcInputModulationGroup15.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the fifteenth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputModulationGroup16.name: plcInputModulationGroup16
plcInputModulationGroup16.description: The new requested modulation amplitude of the sixteenth group of the considered band and channel input values.

plcModulationInputProceed.name: plcModulationInputProceed
plcModulationInputProceed.description: True to request a modification of all the modulations associated to a band and a channel of a remote PLC equipment.

plcModulationInputResult.name: plcModulationInputResult
plcModulationInputResult.description: Result value of the requested modulation value changes.

plcPortChannelTable.name: plcPortChannelTable
plcPortChannelTable.description: This table contains the list of plc channels

plcPortChannelEntry.name: plcPortChannelEntry
plcPortChannelEntry.description: This row contains plc channel information

plcPortChannelIndex.name: plcPortChannelIndex
plcPortChannelIndex.description: The channel number belongs to the remote connection with plc equipment associated with the plcBasePortIndex value. Only three channels are expected. Index 1 for RX channel Index 2 for RXLast channel index 3 for TX channel

plcPortChannelGain.name: plcPortChannelGain
plcPortChannelGain.description: The gain associated with the channel.

plcPortChannelBandwidth.name: plcPortChannelBandwidth
plcPortChannelBandwidth.description: The bandwidth of the channel in Kbit/s.

plcPortChannelMaxBandwidth.name: plcPortChannelMaxBandwidth
plcPortChannelMaxBandwidth.description: The maximum bandwidth of the channel in Kbit/s.

plcPortChannelSynchronizationBand.name: plcPortChannelSynchronizationBand
plcPortChannelSynchronizationBand.description: The synchronization band used for this channel.

plcChannelPilotStringTable.name: plcChannelPilotStringTable
plcChannelPilotStringTable.description: This table contains the string values representing of pilot values of all active channels.

plcChannelPilotStringEntry.name: plcChannelPilotStringEntry
plcChannelPilotStringEntry.description: This row contains a quick access for pilot values , of the remote connection referenced by plcBasePortIndex.

plcRxChannelPilots.name: plcRxChannelPilots
plcRxChannelPilots.description: The carrier wave numbers which support the pilot waves for the Rx Channel. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is a pair of octets representing the pilot values. There is one pair (pilot1 pilot2) for each of the 7 bands.

plcRxLastChannelPilots.name: plcRxLastChannelPilots
plcRxLastChannelPilots.description: The carrier wave numbers which support the pilot waves for the Rx Last Channel. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is a pair of octets representing the pilot values. There is one pair (pilot1 pilot2) for each of the 7 bands.

plcTxChannelPilots.name: plcTxChannelPilots
plcTxChannelPilots.description: The carrier wave numbers which support the pilot waves for the Tx Channel. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is a pair of octets representing the pilot values. There is one pair (pilot1 pilot2) for each of the 7 bands.

plcChannelPilotsTable.name: plcChannelPilotsTable
plcChannelPilotsTable.description: This tabel contains pilots configuration for each plc channel.

plcChannelPilotsEntry.name: plcChannelPilotsEntry
plcChannelPilotsEntry.description: This row contains the pilots 1 and 2 configuration for a channel defined by the couple (plcBasePortIndex, plcPortChannelIndex)

plcChannelPilotBandIndex.name: plcChannelPilotBandIndex
plcChannelPilotBandIndex.description: The band number on which the pilots are defined.

plcChannelPilot1.name: plcChannelPilot1
plcChannelPilot1.description: The carrier wave number which supports the first pilot wave for the channel associated with this entry.

plcChannePilot2.name: plcChannePilot2
plcChannePilot2.description: The carrier wave number which supports the second pilot wave for the channel associated with this entry.

plcPilotsInputAddr.name: plcPilotsInputAddr
plcPilotsInputAddr.description: The MAC address of the MAC layer above the plc interface of the remote PLC equipment for which the pilot value changes are requested.

plcPilotsInputChannel.name: plcPilotsInputChannel
plcPilotsInputChannel.description: The channel type of the remote PLC equipment for which the pilot value changes are requested.

plcPilotsInputBand.name: plcPilotsInputBand
plcPilotsInputBand.description: The band number of which the pilots value changes are requested.

plcInputChannelPilot1.name: plcInputChannelPilot1
plcInputChannelPilot1.description: The carrier wave number which supports the first pilot wave for the considered band and channel input values.

plcInputChannelPilot2.name: plcInputChannelPilot2
plcInputChannelPilot2.description: The carrier wave number which supports the second pilot wave for the considered band and channel input values.

plcPilotsInputProceed.name: plcPilotsInputProceed
plcPilotsInputProceed.description: True to request a modification of the first and second pilot associated to a band and a channel of a remote PLC equipment.

plcPilotsInputResult.name: plcPilotsInputResult
plcPilotsInputResult.description: Result value of the requested pilot values changes.

plcNodeNotches.name: plcNodeNotches
plcNodeNotches.description: The values of the notches for all the node bands. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is an octet representing the 8 notches of each group. There is one value for each 7 * 16 bands.

plcNodeNotchesTable.name: plcNodeNotchesTable
plcNodeNotchesTable.description: This table contains Notches configuration for the SPC200 chip.

plcNodeNotchesEntry.name: plcNodeNotchesEntry
plcNodeNotchesEntry.description: This row contains Notches configuration for a group. The group is defined by the couple (plcNodeNotchesGroupIndex, plcNodeNotchesBandIndex).

plcNodeNotchesBandIndex.name: plcNodeNotchesBandIndex
plcNodeNotchesBandIndex.description: The band number on which the notches are defined.

plcNodeNotchesGroupIndex.name: plcNodeNotchesGroupIndex
plcNodeNotchesGroupIndex.description: The group number on which the notches are defined.

plcNodeNotchesCarrier1.name: plcNodeNotchesCarrier1
plcNodeNotchesCarrier1.description: Tell if the first carrier of the group entry of the band entry is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesCarrier2.name: plcNodeNotchesCarrier2
plcNodeNotchesCarrier2.description: Tell if the second carrier of the group entry of the band entry is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesCarrier3.name: plcNodeNotchesCarrier3
plcNodeNotchesCarrier3.description: Tell if the third carrier of the group entry of the band entry is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesCarrier4.name: plcNodeNotchesCarrier4
plcNodeNotchesCarrier4.description: Tell if the fourth carrier of the group entry of the band entry is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesCarrier5.name: plcNodeNotchesCarrier5
plcNodeNotchesCarrier5.description: Tell if the fifth carrier of the group entry of the band entry is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesCarrier6.name: plcNodeNotchesCarrier6
plcNodeNotchesCarrier6.description: Tell if the sixth carrier of the group entry of the band entry is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesCarrier7.name: plcNodeNotchesCarrier7
plcNodeNotchesCarrier7.description: Tell if the seventh carrier of the group entry of the band entry is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesCarrier8.name: plcNodeNotchesCarrier8
plcNodeNotchesCarrier8.description: Tell if the eighth carrier of the group entry of the band entry is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesInputBand.name: plcNodeNotchesInputBand
plcNodeNotchesInputBand.description: The band number on which the notches value changes are requested.

plcNodeNotchesInputGroup.name: plcNodeNotchesInputGroup
plcNodeNotchesInputGroup.description: The group number on which the notches value changes are requested.

plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier1.name: plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier1
plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier1.description: The first carrier of the considered group and band is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier2.name: plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier2
plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier2.description: The second carrier of the considered group and band is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier3.name: plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier3
plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier3.description: The third carrier of the considered group and band is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier4.name: plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier4
plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier4.description: The fourth carrier of the considered group and band is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier5.name: plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier5
plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier5.description: The eighth carrier of the considered group and band is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier6.name: plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier6
plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier6.description: The eighth carrier of the considered group and band is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier7.name: plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier7
plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier7.description: The seventh carrier of the considered group and band is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier8.name: plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier8
plcNodeNotchesInputCarrier8.description: The eighth carrier of the considered group and band is a notch carrier. The true value means the current carrier is a notch.

plcNodeNotchesInputProceed.name: plcNodeNotchesInputProceed
plcNodeNotchesInputProceed.description: True to request a modification of the carrier notches associated to the considered group and band.

plcNodeNotchesInputResult.name: plcNodeNotchesInputResult
plcNodeNotchesInputResult.description: Result value of the requested node carrier notches value changes.

plcNodePilots.name: plcNodePilots
plcNodePilots.description: The values of the pilot for all the node bands. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is a pair of octets representing the pilot values. There is one pair (pilot1 pilot2) for each of the 7 bands.

plcNodePilotsTable.name: plcNodePilotsTable
plcNodePilotsTable.description: This table contains pilot values used by default on all channels.

plcNodePilotsEntry.name: plcNodePilotsEntry
plcNodePilotsEntry.description: This row contains pilot values used by default on a band. The band is defined by the index plcNodePilotsBandIndex.

plcNodePilotsBandIndex.name: plcNodePilotsBandIndex
plcNodePilotsBandIndex.description: The band number on which the pilot values are defined.

plcNodePilot1.name: plcNodePilot1
plcNodePilot1.description: The default carrier wave number which supports the first pilot wave.

plcNodePilot2.name: plcNodePilot2
plcNodePilot2.description: The default carrier wave number which supports the second pilot wave.

plcNodePilotsInputBand.name: plcNodePilotsInputBand
plcNodePilotsInputBand.description: The band number on which the pilot values changes are requested.

plcInputNodePilot1.name: plcInputNodePilot1
plcInputNodePilot1.description: The default carrier wave number which supports the first pilot wave of the considered band.

plcInputNodePilot2.name: plcInputNodePilot2
plcInputNodePilot2.description: The default carrier wave number which supports the second pilot wave of the considered band.

plcNodePilotsInputProceed.name: plcNodePilotsInputProceed
plcNodePilotsInputProceed.description: True to request a modification of the pilot values associated to the considered band.

plcNodePilotsInputResult.name: plcNodePilotsInputResult
plcNodePilotsInputResult.description: Result value of the requested node pilot values changes.

plcNodeAdaptsStringTable.name: plcNodeAdaptsStringTable
plcNodeAdaptsStringTable.description: This table contains string values for a quick access to the adapt configurations of all the carriers.

plcNodeAdaptsStringEntry.name: plcNodeAdaptsStringEntry
plcNodeAdaptsStringEntry.description: This row contains string values for a quick access to the adapt configuration of each carrier of a band.

plcNodeAdaptsStringBandIndex.name: plcNodeAdaptsStringBandIndex
plcNodeAdaptsStringBandIndex.description: The band number on which the adapt values are defined.

plcNodeAdaptsStringBand.name: plcNodeAdaptsStringBand
plcNodeAdaptsStringBand.description: The adapt values of the 128 carriers of a band. The expected format is VALUE VALUE VALUE ... VALUE. Each value is two octets representing one adapt carrier level. There are ( 16 groups * 8 carriers) = 128 values.

plcNodeAdaptsTable.name: plcNodeAdaptsTable
plcNodeAdaptsTable.description: This table contains adapt level configuration for each carrier of the node.

plcNodeAdaptsEntry.name: plcNodeAdaptsEntry
plcNodeAdaptsEntry.description: This row contains adapt level values for a group of carriers. The group is defined by the couple (plcNodeAdaptsBandIndex,plcNodeAdaptsGroupIndex).

plcNodeAdaptsBandIndex.name: plcNodeAdaptsBandIndex
plcNodeAdaptsBandIndex.description: The band number on which the adapt values are defined.

plcNodeAdaptsGroupIndex.name: plcNodeAdaptsGroupIndex
plcNodeAdaptsGroupIndex.description: The group number on which the adapt values are defined.

plcNodeAdaptsCarrier1.name: plcNodeAdaptsCarrier1
plcNodeAdaptsCarrier1.description: The adapt level of the first carrier of the group.

plcNodeAdaptsCarrier2.name: plcNodeAdaptsCarrier2
plcNodeAdaptsCarrier2.description: The adapt level of the second carrier of the group.

plcNodeAdaptsCarrier3.name: plcNodeAdaptsCarrier3
plcNodeAdaptsCarrier3.description: The adapt level of the third carrier of the group.

plcNodeAdaptsCarrier4.name: plcNodeAdaptsCarrier4
plcNodeAdaptsCarrier4.description: The adapt level of the fourth carrier of the group.

plcNodeAdaptsCarrier5.name: plcNodeAdaptsCarrier5
plcNodeAdaptsCarrier5.description: The adapt level of the fifth carrier of the group.

plcNodeAdaptsCarrier6.name: plcNodeAdaptsCarrier6
plcNodeAdaptsCarrier6.description: The adapt level of the sixth carrier of the group.

plcNodeAdaptsCarrier7.name: plcNodeAdaptsCarrier7
plcNodeAdaptsCarrier7.description: The adapt level of the seventh carrier of the group.

plcNodeAdaptsCarrier8.name: plcNodeAdaptsCarrier8
plcNodeAdaptsCarrier8.description: The adapt level of the eighth carrier of the group.

plcNodeAdaptsInputBand.name: plcNodeAdaptsInputBand
plcNodeAdaptsInputBand.description: The band number on which the adapt level value changes are requested.
